title: Kalphite Lair

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Kalphite Lair is located north-east of the Bedabin Camp, in the Kharidian Desert. Players will need a rope to enter the lair and another to enter the area containing the Kalphite Queen. As the name suggests, only Kalphites live in this area.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Kalphite Hive
Not to be confused with Kalphite Cave.
Kalphite Lair
Released7 September 2004 (Update)
MembersYes
Floors3
LocationKharidian Desert
InhabitantsKalphites
Map
Arabian 3
The music which plays when near the lair
Insect Queen
The music which plays when inside the lair

The Kalphite Lair is located north-east of the Bedabin Camp, in the Kharidian Desert. Players will need a rope to enter the lair and another to enter the area containing the Kalphite Queen. As the name suggests, only Kalphites live in this area.

Players will need to bring a rope every time they visit the lair, and another rope should they wish to reach the Queen's lair; players who have completed the Hard Desert Diary need not do so after attaching the ropes one last time post-diary completion. There is also a crevice shortcut requiring 86 Agility and the Elite Desert Diary to use; it is a two-way shortcut and is helpful for players wishing to kill the Kalphite Queen as it will drop them off in the room leading to her chamber. Entering the Kalphite Lair, as well as collecting 5 potato cacti while inside, are required for the Easy Desert Diary.

Note: You do not need waterskins while inside the lair's entrance.

Contents

  • 1 Getting there
  • 2 First (upper) level
    • 2.1 Additional features
  • 3 Second (lower) level
  • 4 Items recommended
  • 5 Monsters
  • 6 Personalities
  • 7 Music
  • 8 Changes
  • 9 Trivia

Getting there[edit | edit source]

  • Fairy ring - A quick way to access the lair is using the nearby fairy ring with the code BIQ. Then, run north-west towards the lair.
  • Shantay Pass - An alternative is entering the desert via Shantay Pass, which is located south of Al Kharid and requires a Shantay pass, and heading westward to the lair.
  • Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon - Alternatively, those with access to Dorgesh-Kaan will be able to find a blocked tunnel in the Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon that leads through to the lair, emerging near some Kalphite Workers. A light source is necessary to avoid damage from swarming insects.

First (upper) level[edit | edit source]

Reaching Kalphite Lair via Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon.
  • The player needs a rope to access the Kalphite Lair initially and a second rope to reach the Queen. The main entrance requires one rope each visit unless the Hard Desert Diary is done.
  • There is a tunnel to the Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon. If players do not use a light source in this tunnel, they will be repeatedly stung by insects in the darkness.
  • There is a hole to the middle level (the Queen's Lair), which requires the second rope, with the total of two ropes used on this dungeon.

Additional features[edit | edit source]

  • The upper level has many Kalphite Workers and some Kalphite Soldiers, which are popular and great spots for players with a Dwarf multicannon on a Slayer task.
  • Two Kalphite Guardians watch the exit to the second level.
  • Three potato cacti spawn in the chamber with the Kalphite Soldiers on this level.
  • Kalphite larva, which can only be attacked by cats, roam the level.

Second (lower) level[edit | edit source]

The second level has one exit: a rope climb at the east to the first level, which is how players must enter initially.

This level contains the Kalphite Queen as well as two Kalphite Guardians, some Kalphite Workers (only spawned by the Kalphite Queen), and some Kalphite larva. Seven potato cacti spawn on this level.

Items recommended[edit | edit source]

The Kalphite Queen lurking in her lair.
  • Waterskins, a knife, and desert robes (only if travelling through the desert to get to the lair)
  • Up to two ropes - One is needed to initially enter if not from Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon, another for Kalphite Queen.
    • Players who have completed the Hard Desert Diary will not need to bring ropes for subsequent trips. (However, both ropes need to be placed the first time you enter the lair after completing the Diary.)
  • A light source if entering or exiting via the Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon.
  • Good Ranged, Melee or Magic armour
  • Anti-poison potions (or a Prayer book and a Holy symbol)
  • Food
  • Keris dagger if you have completed the Contact! quest or other weapon effective against Kalphites.

Monsters[edit | edit source]

  • Kalphite Worker (level 28)
  • Kalphite Soldier (level 85)
  • Kalphite Guardian (level 141)
  • Kalphite Queen (level 333)

Personalities[edit | edit source]

  • Weird Old Man

Music[edit | edit source]

  • Insect Queen

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
25 November 2020
(update | poll)

The permanent ropes at both the Kalphite Lair and the Kalphite Queen tunnel entrances will now appear with the Hard Diary

2 July 2015
(update | poll)

The agility shortcut unlocked as a reward from the Elite Desert achievement diary now takes you from the very start of the Kalphite Lair directly to the entrance of the Kalphite Queen boss room.

25 June 2015
(update | poll)

Added a 'peek' option to the hole in the upper layer, allowing players to see the number of other players currently in the Queen's Chamber.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

There is now a shortcut in the Kalphite Lair that you can use at level 86 agility if you have completed the Elite Desert achievement diary.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Some players use dwarf multicannons in the lair as the workers and soldiers are good prey if you have a lower Combat level and are hunting kalphites for Slayer. The chamber on the upper level with the potato cactus spawns is a popular cannon spot, since the most kalphite soldiers can be found there. The cannon will be destroyed by the queen if used in her vicinity, however.
  • Kalphite workers often drop waterskins, so you can easily get a new water supply if you ran low when going to the lair.

The '''Kalphite Lair''' is located north-east of the [[Bedabin Camp]], in the [[Kharidian Desert]]. Players will need a [[rope]] to enter the lair and another to enter the area containing the [[Kalphite Queen]]. As the name suggests, only [[Kalphite]]s live in this area.

Players will need to bring a rope every time they visit the lair, and another rope should they wish to reach the Queen's lair; players who have completed the [[Hard Desert Diary]] need not do so after attaching the ropes one last time post-diary completion. There is also a crevice [[shortcut]] requiring 86 [[Agility]] and the [[Elite Desert Diary]] to use; it is a two-way shortcut and is helpful for players wishing to kill the Kalphite Queen as it will drop them off in the room leading to her chamber. Entering the Kalphite Lair, as well as collecting 5 [[potato cacti]] while inside, are required for the [[Easy Desert Diary]].

'''Note:''' You do not need [[waterskin]]s while inside the lair's entrance.

==Getting there==
*[[Fairy ring]] - A quick way to access the lair is using the nearby fairy ring with the code {{Fairycode|BIQ}}. Then, run north-west towards the lair.
*[[Shantay Pass]] - An alternative is entering the desert via Shantay Pass, which is located south of [[Al Kharid]] and requires a [[Shantay pass (item)|Shantay pass]], and heading westward to the lair.
*[[Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon]] - Alternatively, those with access to [[Dorgesh-Kaan]] will be able to find a [[blocked tunnel]] in the Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon that leads through to the lair, emerging near some [[Kalphite Worker|Kalphite Workers]]. A [[light source]] is necessary to avoid damage from swarming insects.

==First (upper) level==
[[File:Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon map.png|thumb|Reaching Kalphite Lair via Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon.]]
*The player needs a [[rope]] to access the Kalphite Lair initially and a second rope to reach the [[Kalphite Queen|Queen]]. The main entrance requires one rope each visit unless the [[Hard Desert Diary]] is done.
*There is a [[blocked tunnel|tunnel]] to the [[Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon]]. If players do not use a [[light source]] in this tunnel, they will be repeatedly stung by insects in the darkness.
*There is a hole to the middle level (the Queen's Lair), which requires the second rope, with the total of two ropes used on this dungeon.

===Additional features===
*The upper level has many [[Kalphite Worker]]s and some [[Kalphite Soldier]]s, which are popular and great spots for players with a [[Dwarf multicannon]] on a [[Slayer task]].
*Two [[Kalphite Guardian]]s watch the exit to the second level.
*Three [[potato cacti]] spawn in the chamber with the Kalphite Soldiers on this level.
*Kalphite larva, which can only be attacked by [[cat]]s, roam the level.

==Second (lower) level==
The second level has one exit: a [[rope]] climb at the east to the first level, which is how players must enter initially.

This level contains the [[Kalphite Queen]] as well as two [[Kalphite Guardian]]s, some [[Kalphite Worker]]s (only spawned by the Kalphite Queen), and some Kalphite larva. Seven [[potato cacti]] spawn on this level.

==Items recommended==
[[File:Kalphite Queen.png|thumb|right|The Kalphite Queen lurking in her lair.]]
*[[Waterskin]]s, a [[knife]], and [[desert robes]] (only if travelling through the desert to get to the lair)
*Up to two [[rope]]s - One is needed to initially enter if not from [[Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon]], another for [[Kalphite Queen]].
**Players who have completed the [[Hard Desert Diary]] will not need to bring ropes for subsequent trips. (However, both ropes need to be placed the first time you enter the lair after completing the Diary.)
*A [[light source]] if entering or exiting via the Dorgesh-Kaan South Dungeon.
*Good [[Ranged]], [[Melee]] or [[Magic armour]]
*[[Anti-poison potion]]s (or a [[Prayer book]] and a [[Holy symbol]])
*[[Food]]
*[[Keris]] dagger if you have completed the [[Contact!]] quest or other weapon effective against [[Kalphite]]s.

==Monsters==
*[[Kalphite Worker]] (level 28)
*[[Kalphite Soldier]] (level 85)
*[[Kalphite Guardian]] (level 141)
*[[Kalphite Queen]] (level 333)

==Personalities==
*[[Weird Old Man]]

==Music==
*[[Insect Queen]]

==Trivia==
*Some players use [[dwarf multicannon]]s in the lair as the [[Kalphite Worker|workers]] and [[Kalphite Soldier|soldiers]] are good prey if you have a lower [[Combat level]] and are hunting [[kalphite]]s for [[Slayer]]. The chamber on the upper level with the [[potato cactus]] spawns is a popular cannon spot, since the most kalphite soldiers can be found there. The cannon will be destroyed by the [[Kalphite Queen|queen]] if used in her vicinity, however.
*Kalphite workers often drop [[waterskin]]s, so you can easily get a new water supply if you ran low when going to the lair.
